::::FilterCommands { CLIList softwareVersion platform verCmds }

################################################################# Procedure Name: FilterCommands Description: Return a list of CLI commands that are filtered based on image version and platform type Input args: CLIList softwareVersion platform verCmds Output args: none Typical usage: set filterList [FilterCommands $groupList [GetVersion DUT1 0] [GetPlatform] verCmds] Category: Utility #################################################################

::::GetGroupList { CLIList listLength indexName }

################################################################# Procedure Name: GetGroupList Description: Retrieve a group of CLI lists(lines) till a cmd keyword Input args: CLIList listLength indexName Output args: none Typical usage: set groupList [GetGroupList $CLIList $listLength index] Category: Utility #################################################################

::::IsInKeywordList { line }

################################################################# Procedure Name: IsInKeywordList Description: Return 1 if Command: is in the line Return 1 if ShowCLI: is in the line Return 1 if ShowCLI_Once: is in the line Return 1 if SendAFile: is in the line Return 1 if DeleteAFile: is in the line Else return 0 Input args: a string line Output args: none Returned vlaue: 1 or 0 Typical usage: IsInKeyWordList $line Category: Utility #################################################################

::::LoadCLIFile { filename }

################################################################# Procedure Name: LoadCLIFile Description: Loads a .cli file into the parser with tcl list scheme Input args: a file name normally with .cli extension Output args: none Typical usage: LoadCLIFile xxxxx.cli Category: Utility #################################################################

::::RunCommandAndCheckCLI { CLIList {flag true} }

################################################################# Procedure Name: RunCommandAndCheckCLI Description: Send the CLI commands within Command: group if flag is "true"; and verify the CLI display by using commands in ShowCLI: group.

Procedure Detail

::::CheckSkipVersion

proc  ::::CheckSkipVersion { firstLine {dutVersion {$DUTs_info(DUT1,version)}} }
################################################################# Procedure Name: CheckSkipVersion Description: Check whether to run upload/download test for the loaded CLI file based on a list of vesions in the first line. If any of the listed versions match DUT's version, the CLI file will be bypassed the test. Input args: firstLine {dutVersion "$DUTs_info(DUT1,version)"} Output args: none Typical usage: if {[CheckSkipVersion $1stLine]} {puts "this file is skipped for CLI test"} Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
CLIFileParser.tcl, line 312

::::RunCommandAndCheckCLI

proc  ::::RunCommandAndCheckCLI { CLIList {flag true} }
################################################################# Procedure Name: RunCommandAndCheckCLI Description: Send the CLI commands within Command: group if flag is "true"; and verify the CLI display by using commands in ShowCLI: group. Input args: CLIList {flag "true"} Output args: none Typical usage: RunCommandAndCheckCLI $CLIList "false" Category: Utility #################################################################
